imho, not. converting a lossy audio format into another lossy one, for storage, is never a good idea.
and the question is, why? you lose quality, you get a bigger file, and mp3 is patented too
if you feel you have to convert your lossily compressed files into something else, FLAC is probably the least of your evils.
who's saying you should convert them in the first place?
of course, FLAC is lossless -- that means files will be an order of magnitude bigger than MP3, WMA or Vorbis
rip them again. converting lossy->lossy is simply a stupid idea
i don't know if it's "worth" it. i know you won't lose quality
don't know, if i had to convert audio i'd probably just pipe a decoder into an encoder
